column3: Ideas shape the course of history.
History does nothing; it does not possess immense riches, it does not fight battles. It is men, real, living, who do all this.

I've always had a Marxist understanding of history: democracy is a result of a broad modernization process that happens in every country. Neocons think the use of political power can force the pace of change, but ultimately it depends on societies doing it themselves.

In the history of the world, all five mass extinctions have been accompanied by massive climate change, so we are facing an incredibly serious threat. In fact, we are technically in the sixth mass extinction right now, and it is the first mass extinction being attributed to humans.

History is a cyclic poem written by time upon the memories of man.

The past is malleable and flexible, changing as our recollection interprets and re-explains what has happened.
